messages.body: @Siretch $aapl go to the annual share holder meeting and learn what wealth thinks.
@Siretch $aapl reduction of shares, dividends more important to wealth investors. Only peeps that cry seem to be inexperienced broke retail
@Siretch $aapl is not a tiny $$$ growth play, there is nothing they can buy that changes bottom line. $NFLX $TLSA tiny $$$ world.
$aapl Wrong, none of those companies produce the same ROI as $200B in dividends and Buyback.

message.body: ~2 years, $AAPL will return $200B to investors via dividend and buyback. They should buy companies, vertical integration, and product dev.

messages.body: $AAPL Apple's services segment is poised to provide plenty of growth in coming years. https://stocknews.com/news/aapl-analyst-apple-inc-aapl-as-a-service-to-provide-next/

links.title: Analyst: Apple Inc. (AAPL) As A Service To Provide Next Leg Of Growth
links.description: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) is about to undergo another paradigm shift that should provide plenty of sustainable long-term growth for investors once again. That's according to fund manager Gene Munster over at Loup Ventures, who points out that this cycle tends to repeat itself every decade or so: About every 10 years, there is a new paradigm that drives investor thinking on the Apple story.

$AAPL Rumor: 'iPhone SE 2' to debut in September with TrueDepth camera... https://goo.gl/xyTGs1

links.title: Rumor: 'iPhone SE 2' to debut in September with TrueDepth camera
links.description: According to the latest industry scuttlebutt out of China, production of a refreshed iPhone SE smartphone has not yet started, suggesting Apple plans to debut the device alongside flagship models in September. Citing a Chinese accessory manufacturer that exhibited wares at the Japan IT Week Spring Mobile Solutions Expo, Mac Otakara reports Apple's iPhone SE successor is unlikely to make an appearance in the second quarter of 2018.

links.description: Sergei Konkov | Getty Images Inside the Pentagon's cyberwarfare unit, analysts have been closely monitoring internet traffic out of Iran.
